items.text: Jarvis slings this one down short, but it's the slower ball and Kayes is much too early in his pull. The ball takes the cue end and bounces through to Taylor.
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: Jarvis is keeping things very tight, and once again this is defended.
items.postText: The Reichenbach: "@Jai I disagree with you. With the world cup being at England. A batsman who bowls medium pace is an auto selection without any other options available. I would rather be surprised if he gets axed. And he's gaining form too. "
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: Oops, but his fielders aren't! Kayes scoops a drive towards Zhuwao at mid-off, but the fielder fluffs his stop and they're back for a second.
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, 2 runs

items.text: in the air, but it drops short!. Kayes' timing evades him as he swivels into a pull, deliberately in the air. Fortunately for him he times it so badly that it falls well short of the fielder running in.
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, 2 runs

items.text: Jarvis ends a solid over with another ball aimed full and zoning in on off stump. Kayes steps into a neat front foot defence.
items.postText: Mujahid Rahman: "I support both Liton & Kayes. But I think management would back Liton as an opening partner with Tamim keeping his aggressive batting in mind as well as right hand/left hand combination. If Soumya performs well he can take the role of a finisher at no 6 or 7."
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.preText: Raza to continue. And he's got a slip in place for the new man.
items.text: looped up on middle, and Mahmud lunges forward to smother the ball.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Fazle Mahmud, no run

items.text: just a little wide of off, and he's back and across to punch to cover.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Fazle Mahmud, no run

items.text: speared down a little faster through the air, and Mahmud hurries his defence
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Fazle Mahmud, no run

items.text: and this one he holds back. A defensive prod sends the ball to gully. Good over so far from the bowler
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Fazle Mahmud, no run

items.text: What's happened here? Is this a stumping? Raza floated one up and Mahmud skipped out to meet the ball, but he over-balanced and missed it. Taylor juggles his take, and by the time he can disturb the bails (his arms tucked up like chicken wings to hold the ball), Mahmud is scurrying back to the crease. The third umpire is brought into service, and he's short!
items.postText: That was mighty close. A matter of millimetres. But Zimbabwe have two quick wickets thanks to Raza. Is this an opening?
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Fazle Mahmud, OUT

dismissal.text: Fazle Mahmud st †Taylor b Sikandar Raza 0 (5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

items.text: well, there's a little turn! Raza fizzes an offspinner in to Musfiqur, who dabs at it with a somewhat hurried defence
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: nishant kesharw: "Fazle Mahmud joins Tendulkar, Kane Willimason and Sadeera Samarawickrama in the list of batsman who were were dismissed for duck in first 2 odi innings."
items.text: dug in by Jarvis, and again Kayes struggles to time the pull. But he places it wide of square leg, so there's a single.
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.preText: Masakadza's put a man at a catching midwicket for Mushfiqur.
items.text: there's a touch of wobble on this one, in through the air, but Mushfiqur keeps it out with studied defence
items.shortText: Jarvis to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: slower ball, and Mushfiqur has to wait on it before he pushes towards point.
items.shortText: Jarvis to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: a nicely placed drive has both the mid off and cover fielders racing after it, and they hunt the ball down short of the rope to keep them to two.
items.shortText: Jarvis to Mushfiqur Rahim, 2 runs

items.text: Jarvis pushes one too far down the leg side, and Umpire Rod Tucker calls wide. That's his first wide of the match
items.shortText: Jarvis to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 wide

items.text: there's a bit more intent in this delivery, and it rises and shapes away outside off. Mushfiqur leaves alone, and Taylor lets the bowler know he likes the delivery
items.shortText: Jarvis to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: Jarvis hones in on at that nagging off stump line, and Mushfiqur presses watchfully into the covers.
items.postText: AM: "Both the wickets were gifted by the batsmen when they were in control. BD cannot afford these mistakes in the World Cup."
items.shortText: Jarvis to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Raza continues. This has been a great spell from him.
items.text: looped down full and straight, and it's tucked to leg.
items.postText: Jai: "Unless something comes up, our formidable fast bowlers in the XI will be Rubel, Mustafiz, and Mashrafe. Soumya scoring a list a century against Zimbabwe doesn't necessarily mean his form is improving, unless he shows up for the next game. They will need a solid middle order batsmen, and then if they do need a batsmen with pace, they'll look at Saifuddin. One things for sure though, Mahmud won't be in world cup plans at the moment.."
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: pushed to the off side this time, Raza giving nothing away.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: Kayes comes forward to defend it right under his eyes.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: off the leading edge! This track is definitely starting to slow up and turn a little. Kayes goes back to one that dips on him, and the ball turns away to take the outer half of the bat. It falls safely, but conditions are getting a little tricky.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: too much width, and it's thrashed through point for a brace.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, 2 runs

items.text: Kayes is forward now, and he drives to long off to keep the strike.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.preText: There's a change in the attack, Tiripano replacing Jarvis.
items.text: Tiripano's line is a little too close to leg stump, and Kayes collects a single to short fine
items.shortText: Tiripano to Imrul Kayes, 1 leg bye
